ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How frequently do you hear a voice or voices?
Notes: 0=Less than once a day; 1=Once or twice a day; 2=Several times a day; 3=All of the time/Constantly

ElementDescription: How bad are the things the voices say to you?
Notes: 0=No voices saying bad things; 1=Not that bad; 2=Fairly bad; 3=Very bad; 4=Horrible
0=Voices not present; 1=Very quiet (like whispering); 2=Average (same as my own voice); 3=Fairly loud; 4=Very loud (yelling or shouting)

ElementDescription: How long do the voices usually last?
Notes: 0=Voices not present; 1=A few seconds to 1 minute; 2=A few minutes; 3=More than 10 minutes but less than an hour; 4=Longer than 1 hour / they just seem to persist

ElementDescription: How much do the voices interfere with your daily activities?
Notes: 0=No interference; 1=A little bit; 2=Moderately; 3=Quite a bit; 4=Extremely interfering

ElementDescription: How distressing are the voices that you hear?
Notes: 0=No voices are distressing me; 1=A little bit; 2=Moderately; 3=Quite a bit; 4=Extremely distressing

ElementDescription: How bad (worthless/useless) do the voices make you feel about yourself?
Notes: 0=No voices make me feel bad; 1=A little bit; 2=Fairly bad; 3=Very bad; 4=Extremely bad (as bad as I can feel)

ElementDescription: How clearly do you hear the voices?
Notes: 0=Voices not present; 1=Very mumbled; 2=Fairly mumbled; 3=Fairly clear; 4=Very clear voices

ElementDescription: How often do you do what the voices say?
Notes: 0=No voices telling me what to do; 1=Rarely; 2=Sometimes; 3=Often; 4=Always

ElementDescription: In what part of the day do you head the voices most often?
Notes: 0=The voices are equally as likely at all times of the day; 1=Morning; 2=Afternoon; 3=Evening; 4=Just before bed

ElementDescription: What kind of social situations are you in most often when your voices start?
Notes: 0=No situation in particular / they occur equally in all social situations; 1=When I am alone; 2=When I am with a few people (like in group); 3=When I am around a lot of people (like in a mall or on a busy street)

ElementDescription: Where do the voices come from?
Notes: 0=From inside my head; 1=From outside my head; 2=From both inside and outside of my head

ElementDescription: Would you say the last week is like a typical week of your hearing voices?
